body:
Unfortunately, it looks like there wasn't enough interest from the team
or community to implement this change. While we wish we'd be able to
accommodate everyone's requests, we do need to prioritize. We've found
that issues failing to reach accepted status after 21 days tend to
never be accepted, and as such, we [close those issues](https://eslint.org/docs/maintainer-guide/issues#when-to-close-an-issue).
This doesn't mean the idea isn't interesting or useful, just that it's
not something the team can commit to.

Thanks for contributing to ESLint and we appreciate your understanding.

[//]: # (auto-close)
Reopening as I believe this isn't intended behavior, but would like more opinions.

rename.from: --cache stores source code in the cache file on the second run
rename.to: `--cache` stores source code in the cache file on the second run

body: Yes, I can still reproduce this with eslintrc, and now with flat config as well. I'm working on the fix.

I've located the problem. `getCachedLintResults()` adds `source` on the `results` object that `fileDescriptor` references, so `reconcile()` just saves it later if `setCachedLintResults()` wasn't called. 

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/a58aa200fccedae7e2e9b6129246f2cedab14f8d/lib/cli-engine/lint-result-cache.js#L136-L137

Returning a clone fixes the issue. I'll submit the fix, but I also found that the existing tests don't work as intended, so I'd like to fix that first.
I'm working on this now. I also noticed that `usedDeprecatedRules` property of lint results can mistakenly be stored in the cache file (though this can only happen when ESLint is used through API).

issue.title: fix: Ensure that extra data is not accidentally stored in the cache file

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[x] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

Fixes #13507

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Updated `getCachedLintResults()` to return cloned lint results instead of the ones that `file-entry-cache` references. This should ensure that changes to these objects will not be accidentally stored in the cache file when `reconcile()` is called. 

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

* All 4 test cases (2 for the FlatESLint class, and 2 equivalent for the ESLint class) were failing before this change.
* The previous code was checking if `fileDescriptor.meta.results` is falsy. I added this check to preserve the behavior, though I'm not sure if that can ever happen.
* I think there's no need for deep cloning.

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
